Breadth-First.Explanation: Initial broad clue collection by identifying core visual elements without any specific location hypothesis.
Continued divergent exploration by isolating features and suggesting a general region (Southern Europe) based on Mediterranean architectural style.

Depth-First.Explanation: Derived a concrete hypothesis (French Riviera) from key clues and planned targeted verification.
Depth-First.KeyElement: French Riviera hypothesis based on French flag, terracotta roofs, stucco walls and seagull

Depth-First.Explanation: Focused analysis on unique building arrangements within the hypothesized region to narrow down specific towns.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Prominent corner building and clustered layout in old town Riviera areas

Depth-First.Explanation: Convergent examination of candidate towns using online imagery tools to match architectural details.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Comparison of old town areas of Antibes, Cannes, Villefranche-sur-Mer, Cassis via Google Images and Street View

Depth-First.Explanation: Identified Vieil Antibes as the likely match and prepared final validation with Street View.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Corner building and surrounding structure layout matching Vieil Antibes

Depth-First.Explanation: Zeroed in on the precise building arrangement and flag detail for the final verification step.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Specific building arrangement and French flag alignment

Depth-First.Explanation: Performed rigorous cross-referencing on Google Maps and Street View to confirm Vieil Antibes.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Exact match of foreground corner building with bay windows and building cluster

Breadth-Depth Switch.Explanation: Shifted from broad region suggestion to a specific hypothesis (French Riviera) and planning its verification.
